item.title: Debugging JavaScript in Chrome DevTools
item.description: Get Started Step 2: Get familiar with the Sources panel UI The Sources panel is where you debug JavaScript. Open DevTools by pressing Command+Option+I (Mac) or Control+Shift+I (Windows, Linux). This shortcut opens the Consolepanel. Step 3: Pause the code with a breakpoint Step 4: Step through the code Step 5: Set a line-of-code breakpoint Step 6: Check variable values

item.title: JavaScript
item.description: A Tour of JavaScript Lexical grammar The Text of a JavaScript Program JavaScript is a case-sensitive language. JavaScript ignores spaces that appear between tokens in programs. For the most part, JavaScript also ignores line breaks. let a a = 3 console.log(a) JavaScript interprets this code like this: let a; a = 3; console.log(a); Comments // This is a single-line comment. /* This is also a comment */ // and here
